Sentencas: In reversible solid oxide cells (RSOCs) with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte and LSCF6428-based oxygen electrode, a GDC barrier layer is used to prevent inter-diffusion of constituents.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: However, the performance of such RSOC is limited to the achievable density of GDC at prevailing temperatures of traditional fabrication methods.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: In this work, the GDC barrier layer was densified via infiltration with polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP) chelated metal precursors sol and subsequent sintering at 1200 degrees C. The NiO-YSZ fuel electrode-supported RSOCs with YSZ electrolyte, porous or infiltrated GDC barrier layer and LSCF6428-GDC composite oxygen electrode were fabricated.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: The RSOCs were analyzed with respect to operating temperature (650-800 degrees C), water partial pressure at fuel electrode (pH2OFE=0.03-0.5 atm), oxygen partial pressure at oxygen electrode (pO2AE=0.02-0.21 atm) and current loading.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: The performance evaluation, using current-voltage curve and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS), showed that the RSOC with an infiltrated GDC barrier layer exhibited a 32-48% increase in performance in fuel cell (FC) mode in the 650-800 degrees C range, compared to that of the RSOC with a porous GDC layer.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: Similarly, in electrolysis cell (EC) mode, comparing current density at 1.3 V, chosen as the reference voltage for ease of comparison, based on a thermoneutral voltage of 1.285 V in electrolysis cell (EC) operation at 750 degrees C[1], the RSOC with an infiltrated GDC barrier layer exhibited values of over 1.2 A center dot cm_ 2, in contrast to the RSOC with a porous GDC barrier layer, which showed 0.8 A center dot cm_ 2.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: In the case of the RSOC with infiltrated GDC, a durability test was conducted at 750 degrees C under an EC current density of 1A center dot cm_2for 100 h. Our experimental results demonstrate that the RSOC with an infiltrated GDC barrier layer not only exhibits enhanced performance but also maintains stability.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface

Sentencas: Comparative analysis was conducted using Distribution of Relaxation Time (DRT) analysis of Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS) data, to further understand the differences between the cells.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of reversible solid oxide fuel cells by densification of Gd0.1Ce0.9O2_δ (GDC) barrier layer/La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3_δ (LSCF6428)-GDC oxygen-electrode interface
